SENT.plain: The clinical course of three patients who had combined sagittal and lateral sinus dural fistulae is described
One patient, with impending blindness and a short life span, underwent right lateral sinus thrombosis in one stage
The second patient underwent sagittal and right lateral sinus thrombosis in four stages, and her remaining lateral sinus spontaneously occluded
A small untreated fistula persists in the right lower sigmoid
The third patient underwent sagittal sinus, left lateral sinus, and left parietal sinus thrombosis in six stages
A small untreated far-anterior fistula persists
The small asymptomatic untreated residual fistulae have no demonstrable retrograde venous drainage and, therefore, require no treatment at this time
